title: A vote of 3/1 should result in a surrender
body: There is no **good** reason for this not being implemented.

This isnt politics, this is a videogame. The default is no surrender, as its a forced opt in to confirm the choice. This way, if anything goes wrong, you arent forcing a player to lose a game due to some random bug not letting them see or choose the option they want.

With the current surrender vote system, "no" means the same thing as an abstention. As it stands, the only purpose of the "no" button is to potentially arrive at the result sooner. Clicking "no" as opposed to not clicking anything doesn't affect the outcome at all. If the meaning of abstention in this system were to change, you would see different voting behavior.

TL;DR: With this change, the surrender often still wouldn't go through, because the 3/1 would be 3/2.
Idk why it doesn't follow the majority vote in ALL cases, and not just when all 5 people vote. A majority vote should mean that a 3/1 or 2/1 vote decides something as well.
As long as it doesn't, just make it result in a 4v5. No reason remaining stuck in a game you're enjoying any longer, and if someone is dragging the vote, they should pay for it.
